title: Rotational dynamics - hoop spinning and rolling

content.question: In Figure <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>, a hoop is spinning in place with constant angular velocity <math alttext="omega" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>ω</mi></math> on a smooth surface with negligible friction. In Figure <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>, the same hoop is rolling without slipping to the right with constant angular velocity <math alttext="omega" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>ω</mi></math> on a rough surface where friction is not negligible. Which of the following correctly compares the net torque and net force exerted on the hoop in Figures <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> and <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>?

choices.label: The net force and the net torque are zero in both figures.
The net force is zero in both figures, but the net torque is nonzero in Figure <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>.
The net torque is zero in both figures, but the net force is nonzero in Figure <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>.

The net force and net torque are both zero in Figure <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>, but the net torque and net force are both nonzero in Figure <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>.

content.answer: The net force and the net torque are zero in both figures.
